INSTRUMENT: REAGAN SUNPHOTOMETER HOST: FIELD EXPERIMENT
Instrument Information ====================== Instrument Id : REAG Instrument Host Id : FEXP Instrument Name : REAGAN SUNPHOTOMETER Instrument Type : SPECTROMETER
Instrument Description ====================== The Reagan Sunphotometer is used to characterize the optical depth over a given site and at a given time and wavelength. This photometer was built under the supervision of Dr. John Reagan, University of Arizona, Tucson. It has 10 spectral channels, each about 10 nm in bandwidth, fast response, low noise, and an internal filter wheel. The channel wavelengths are 0.37, 0.40, 0.44, 0.52, 0.61 (for ozone), 0.67, 0.78, 0.87, 0.94 (for water vapor), and 1.03 micrometers. The angular field of view is 2 degrees. The detector is a photodiode. The output voltages of the instrument are proportional to the incident irradiances within a given band, although no calibration relating voltage to physical units is required.
To prepare the Reagan sunphotometer for data collection, the instrument was mounted to a tripod, the detector heater turned on, and the detector temperature monitored to verify stability at 40 +/- 0.5 degrees C. Operator time clocks were set to the nearest second using a portable radio tuned to WWV. The instrument was then aligned such that the solar disk passes through a site at the front of the optical barrel and onto a cross-hair reticle. Alignment was verified by observing that the output voltage was maximized for this position. Next the start time was recorded to the nearest second, the filter wheel sequenced through its ten positions, a gain and voltage recorded for each channel, and a final stop time recorded.
Science Objectives ================== Measure atmospheric optical depth.
